comments.body: I think aws_keys_argument_spec would be a better method name.

To be honest, aws_argument_spec is also better than ec2_argument spec, and "aws.py" is a better name than "ec2.py" at this point as well. My main intent with this pull request was to fix the RDS error with the least amount of disruption. Happy to change it all if @mpdehaan wishes it so.

should be `aws_secret_key = ...`.

In my recent refactoring I just went with `secret_key` and `access_key`, but `aws_secret_key` and `aws_access_key` are better variable names than `ec2_secret_key` and `ec2_access_key`

Again, the main point of this request is to fix the aws_ vs. ec2_ module argument problem introduced in the rds module.

With respect to "secret_key" and "access_key", I considered those but rejected them as too generic, particularly given that the common boto environment variable names are AWS_SECRET_KEY and AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID. Although that last one doesn't entirely match either. :-P

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@
    ec2_url = module.params.get('ec2_url')
    ec2_secret_key = module.params.get('aws_secret_key')
    ec2_access_key = module.params.get('aws_access_key')
    region = module.params.get('region')
